fields.description: Garrett sent Scott another round of IG feedback (includes VPC edits and more).

attachment.filename: Euca 422 Install Guide with gholms markup 2016-04-04.pdf

fields.summary: More Installation Guide feedback from Garrett

comments.body: Hi, [~kmeredith], you have this feedback, correct?
[~dmitrii] got it in PDF form, yes, thank you. :) and special thanks to [~gholms] for taking the time!

I read it that way because the sentence about SANs immediately followed a sentence about alternative object storage providers without specifying that they are instead block storage providers.  Consider something along these lines:

bq. Riak CS clusters provide an alternative to Walrus as an object storage provider.  SAN clusters, available to Eucalyptus subscribers, provide alternatives to direct-attached storage and Ceph as block storage providers.

Given the compromises inherent to Ceph-RGW, I think we should continue to omit it from that paragraph, personally.

The original text was not clear about the distinction between alternative options for block and object storage. So I agree with [~gholms]'s phrasing but it sounds like the use of 'alternative' here somehow implies better - in that sense I'm not entirely sure whether SANs are an alternative to Ceph for block storage. I might be entirely missing the point here

[~gholms] can you take a look at this page please: http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/#install-guide/credentials_admin_create.html 
Also you have notes in the mark-up that I do not fully understand on this page. If you can help me understand, I'll get to them as soon as I can ...
See the snippet I just attached [~gholms]
I would assume that the InfrastructureAdministrator does not have sufficient permission to set up a cloud (unless this is a use case that we test)

Updated also This page:  http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.3.0/#install-guide/index.html
provides minimal packages included at install. Pretty much the most basic OS
7.2 is good (instead of 7.0)

Updated http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/master/index.html#install-guide/credentials_admin_create.html but do not understand the nuances of [~gholms] 3 assumptions and [~sjones] reply above.

[~gholms] can you review this page ^ update to see if I've got it right?

I advise against including admin roles in the main installation narrative since they are still an untested, niche feature.  That would likely be better off in the form of a note at the top of the page that refers to an appendix with instructions one can follow instead of the rest of that page.  Even then, [~sjones] indicated that we don't know if they even work for installation.  I'm beginning to wonder if the admin guide would be a better place for it instead.
OK reverted the change and created the new DOC-1987 as an improvement use case.
This mark-up still has important notes to improve VPC. However the critical work was done before now.
